sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"恐惧，惧怕，惊恐"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: alarm, fear, fright, horror, panic, terror, dread
means: alarm ：强调突然意识到有危险而产生的恐惧心理。
fear ：普通用词，侧重指面临危险或灾祸时内心所引起的恐惧心情。
fright ：通常指一阵突然的、令人震惊的短暂恐惧，有时含夸张意味。
horror ：侧重指因看到令人讨厌或危险的东西或情景而引起的厌恶情绪、极度恐惧心情或战栗的动作。
panic ：常指因突如其来的外界威胁使人群出现惊慌、恐惧或混乱。
terror ：指极大的恐惧和惊骇，语气最强。
dread ：可与fear换用，着重害怕的心理，但dread常指胆怯和丧失勇气。

sentence.Network_en: I dread to think what our telephone bill is going to be.
sentence.Network_cn: 我不敢想象我们的电话费会有多少。

sentence.Network_en: I've got to go home, but Lord knows I dread it.
sentence.Network_cn: 我必须得回家了，不过是个人都知道我很怕回去。

sentence.Network_en: The old dread knotted her stomach.
sentence.Network_cn: 从前那些可怕的经历让她的心都揪紧了。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English ādræ̃dan, ondræ̃dan, of West Germanic origin; related to Old High German intrātan

entry.def: If you dread something which may happen, you feel very anxious and unhappy about it because you think it will be unpleasant or upsetting.

example.tran: 今年我非常害怕过圣诞节。

example.ex: I dreaded coming back, to be honest...

entry.def: Dread is a feeling of great anxiety and fear about something that may happen.

example.ex: She thought with dread of the cold winters to come.
example.tran: 她害怕即将来临的寒冷冬季。

entry.def: Dread means terrible and greatly feared.

example.ex: ...a more effective national policy to combat this dread disease.
example.tran: 对抗这可怕疾病的更有效的国家政策

entry.tran: 恼火的;生气的;不想要的
entry.def: You can use dread to describe something that you, or a particular group of people, find annoying or undesirable.

example.tran: 令人不快的短语“政治上正确”

entry.def: If you say that you dread to think what might happen, you mean that you are anxious about it because it is likely to be very unpleasant.

example.ex: I dread to think what will happen in the case of a major emergency...
example.tran: 我不敢想在重大紧急情况下会发生什么。

example.ex: I dread to think what Hollywood is planning to do with this interesting little story.
example.tran: 我不敢想好莱坞打算如何处理这个有趣的小故事。

sentences.sentence: "the student looked around the examination room with apprehension"

means.word_mean: 1. be afraid or scared of; be frightened of;
1. causing fear or dread or terror;

sentences.sentence: "a career or vengeance so direful that London was shocked"
"polio is no longer the dreaded disease it once was"

auth_sentence.content: Executioners should feel dread and guilt about their killings.
auth_sentence.res_content: Executioners should feel dread and guilt about their killings.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Executioners should feel dread and guilt about their killings.

auth_sentence.content: I simply do not believe your expression of dread.

auth_sentence.content: Climate change offered a particularly potent source of dread.
auth_sentence.res_content: Climate change offered a particularly potent source of dread.

means.word_mean: 害怕, 恐惧; 担心

sentences.en: We all dread to think what will happen if the company closes.
sentences.cn: 我们都不敢去想一旦公司关门我们该怎么办。

sentences.en: The little boy dreads going to bed in the dark.
sentences.cn: 这孩子不敢在黑暗中睡觉。
